snippet: The selection of Andrea Stewart-Cousins to replace John L. Sampson comes in the wake of the party’s failure to take control of the chamber despite holding a numerical majority.
abstract: New York Democrats in the State Senate oust Majority leader John L Sampson of Brooklyn, and replace him with Andrea Stewart-Cousins of Westchester County; she will be the first woman to lead a conference in the State Legislature; Democrats, smarting over their inability to take control of the chamber despite being in the majority, hope Stewart-Cousins will help them take back political control.
lead_paragraph: The selection of Andrea Stewart-Cousins to replace John L. Sampson comes in the wake of the party’s failure to take control of the chamber despite holding a numerical majority.

headline.seo: Senate Democrats in Albany Replace Their Leader
headline.main: Senate Democrats Vote to Oust Their Leader
headline.print_headline: Democrats In the Senate Vote to Oust Their Leader
